intro: Thelypodium lasiophyllum, commonly known as the woolly thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage that covers the stems and leaves, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. Thelypodium lasiophyllum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
